cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 335 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend and the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Panama City–Port St. Joe area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Chassahowitzka to Anna Maria Island, FL including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical Storm Warning from Alabama/Florida border to Chassahowitzka FL (north of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast from Alabama/Florida border across the Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, extending southward to the Tampa Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible tonight through Wednesday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible from Aripeka to Anna Maria Island including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain expected over the Tampa Bay/Manatee area, locally higher in bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado risk beginning late tonight
